title: unable to git clone /// on windows

labels.name: severity-important
labels.description: major effect on the usability of a package, without rendering it completely unusable to everyone

body:
Tried in git bash and conda (conda installed `git`), getting the same
```
(base) C:\tmp>git clone http://datasets.datalad.org/.git
Cloning into 'datasets.datalad.org'...
Fetching objects: 11320, done.
error: invalid path 'con'
fatal: unable to checkout working tree
warning: Clone succeeded, but checkout failed.
You can inspect what was checked out with 'git status'
and retry with 'git restore --source=HEAD :/'
```

anyone saw such one, has a clue on WTF, or why `con` is so special?

<details><summary>WTF within conda env</summary>
